result.execSummary:
All charges against Joshua Jerome Staples in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Jerome Staples is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Jerome Staples

records.addlTxt:
10:53 AM Cases 22CF86, 22CF87, and 22TR260 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Jerome Staples appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Joshua Jerome Staples. Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: plea date needed, anticipates PSI.  Atty Chapman recites agreement.
Plea hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 10:45 am.

11:46 AM Cases 22CF86 and 22CF87 called together.  Defendant Joshua Jerome Staples in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases are on for adjoined preliminary hearing (parties stipulate).  State calls first witness, Detective Travis Thiex, who is sworn in and testifies.  State shows witness part of the criminal complaint to refresh recollection.  Atty Chapman crosses.  Atty Rennicke redirects.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  State calls second witness, Patrol Captain Julie Mead, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Atty Chapman crosses.  No redirect.  No arguments.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matters are bound over for further proceedings.  The State files informations mirroring complaints, but notes he may add charges later.  Discussion of potentially added charges.  Cases proceed to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 11:45 am.

02:12 PM Called 22CF86 & 22CF87 for INIT.  Defendant Joshua Jerome Staples in court by video with attorney Christian J Ness in person.  Defendant in custody from Burnett County jail. DA James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Both cases on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG entered on misdemeanors.  Confirmed defs address and phone #.  Attny Ness waive PH today.  Def actually wishes to have PHs.  Attny Ness requests to set PH within time limits.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:21 PM Cases 22CF86 and 22CF87 called together.  Defendant Joshua Jerome Staples in court with attorney Gabriel Pollak appearing by video in place of attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Joshua Jerome Staples appeared by video means with Attorney.  Cases on for an Initial Appearance.  Atty Pollak requests adjournment; granted.  Bond continues.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of burglarious tools.  No contact with victims, their residences, or their businesses.    The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
